column4: hi there, anybody know how i could use a usb video grabber with ubuntu?
those are the kind of peripherals that your chances are slim to get workin in linuc
er linux
when i connect the usb video grabber to ubuntu it is nnot recognised..... i'll but her back in the box so... what a pity.
extended software may assume wifi control, i just never seen it required :/
but laptops are the biggest pita there is
i'll will send you a cd !!
and usb video grabber, anyone?
ActionParsnip... i could try cheese but its a video grabber for vhs conversion... any way of using this?
ActionParsnip... thanks anyways.. anyone used a usb video grabber to capture video on ubuntu?
cheese just says no device found!
so is there any software for video grabbers or any way to get my machine to recognise it?
If you can try to find the 'chipset' you adapter uses, then you can search for generic linux support options. It might get you further than by searching by product name
jebby thanks... how would i find out what chipset it is? it is only recognised and not named as a usb device
what exactly is this usb adapter, Make, Model etc?
silvercrest usb video grabber 'vg2010'
what does lsusb command show u in terminal
usb adapter must be in first obviously
jebby for the device itself it just shows = Bus 001 Device 014: ID 1d19:6105
the actual manufacturer is Dexatek Technology. http://www.dexatek.com Still cant confirm linux support
jebby.. excellent dude
jebby that site is a bit crap
I only see linux support for 1D19:1101  DK DVB-T Dongle , 1D19:1102  DK mini DVB-T Dongle, and  1D19:1103  DK 5217 DVB-T Dongle. I think your outta luck
